One Dollar Logos

I'm starting an experiment today.

Every week I'll be designing a logo for a new client—starting at the low price of $1. The catch here is that with each project, the price will double. The second logo will cost $2. The third, $4. The 9th, $256. The 13th $4,096.

When you sign up, you are applying to have your logo designed by me. If accepted, upon completion of the project (est. time one week) you will receive the following:

  • One logo and concept (may include an alternate color variation) in high resolution and vector formats
  • The design files (.psd / .ai)

The terms:

  • Half payment is due before work begins, and half upon sending the final documents.
  • You have license to use this logo wherever you want, but NOT to alter it
  • Your new logo will be proudly displayed on this page (or one similar to it) as a representation of past work from OneLogo

Why am I doing this? Good question

A good friend of mine is starting his own business and challenged me to do the same. I thought, "What's the smallest thing I could do for someone for $1?" I suppose you have to start somewhere, right? The 'start with $1 and increase' model I adapted from OneHour.me.

Anyways...
